p.s: The drama Disgraced, Scene 3 by Ayad Akhtar, published in 2013, deals with islamophobia caused by the fear of terror in the USA at the example of a marriage between the white woman Emily and Amir, a man of South-Asian origin.
The drama reveals the problems of faith, stigmatization and cultural values.
At the beginning of the excerpt at hand, Isaac and Emily are kissing.
Isaac and his wife Jory were invited for a dinner at Amir's and Emily's home.
Jory, a black woman who wanted to get champagnerchampagne for the dinner with Amir, surprises Isaac and Emily.
She is shocked and accuses Isaac and Emily of having an affair.
Amir comes in too, angry about something that happendhappened to him with Jory before but then recognizing the situation they are in.
Isaac and Emily deny having an affair.
Emily tells Amir and Jory that Isaac consoled and hugged her because she cried.
Jory insists of what she saw while Amir believes Emily and accuses Jory as well of first stealing his job and then trying to destroy his marriage.
He gets angry at Jory and the scene escalates: in an emotional outbreak he entitles himself with the n-word making aware of all the injustices he went through at work in comparison to Jory.
Isaac tries to intervene in the conflict and ends up to get spit into his face of Amir.
Afterwards, Isaac and Emily leave.
When they are gone Emily makes clear her anger about Amir.
She wants him to get sober and makes a coffee for her husband.
Returning to him, Amir asks her if she had an affair with Isaac.
Emily breaks in and tells him the truth about her cheating when Isaac and she were in London.
She tries to say sorry to Amir but instead of accepting if he hits her in the face.
The situation ends up in a violent outburst of Amir.
At the end of the scene Emily lies on the ground with her face blooded while Amir realises what he did and Abe, Amir's nephew, comes in unexpected, seeing Emily and Amir.
